Question: Wedriver Windows popup handling: :This question already has answers here:                                                            Closed 10 years ago.Possible Duplicate:display image from URL retrieved from ALAsset in iPhone My code is:Set<String> windowsid = driver.getWindowHandles();Iterator<String> iterate = windowsid.iterator();while(iterate.hasNext()){    System.out.println(iterate.next());}String mainwindow_id = iterate.next();String tabbedwindow_id = iterate.next();I get an error @ String mainwindow_id = iterate.next();Stating the below, Line 45 is the one i have in quotes.   I have declared the Set as StringPlease Help !Exception in thread "main" java.util.NoSuchElementExceptionat java.util.LinkedHashMap$LinkedHashIterator.nextEntry(LinkedHashMap.java:375)at java.util.LinkedHashMap$KeyIterator.next(LinkedHashMap.java:384)at windows.traverse.main(traverse.java:45)
Please using this api: Iterator.next.

Question: Wedriver Windows popup handling: :This question already has answers here:                                                            Closed 10 years ago.Possible Duplicate:display image from URL retrieved from ALAsset in iPhone My code is:Set<String> windowsid = driver.getWindowHandles();Iterator<String> iterate = windowsid.iterator();while(iterate.hasNext()){    System.out.println(iterate.next());}String mainwindow_id = iterate.next();String tabbedwindow_id = iterate.next();I get an error @ String mainwindow_id = iterate.next();Stating the below, Line 45 is the one i have in quotes.   I have declared the Set as StringPlease Help !Exception in thread "main" java.util.NoSuchElementExceptionat java.util.LinkedHashMap$LinkedHashIterator.nextEntry(LinkedHashMap.java:375)at java.util.LinkedHashMap$KeyIterator.next(LinkedHashMap.java:384)at windows.traverse.main(traverse.java:45)
Please using this api: Iterator.next.
Answer: The error is because you are trying to get the next element from the iterator after it has already iterated over all the elements. In your case, you are trying to get the next element after you have already iterated over the two windows.

The solution is to store the first and second window ids in separate variables before you try to get the next window id. Here is the corrected code:

```java
Set<String> windowsid = driver.getWindowHandles();
Iterator<String> iterate = windowsid.iterator();

String mainwindow_id = iterate.next();
String tabbedwindow_id = iterate.next();
```

This way, you are only trying to get the next element when you actually need it.

This should resolve your error.

<<<api>>>: Iterator.next
<<<code>>>: String mainwindow_id = iterate.next();
<<<explanation>>>: This line is trying to get the next element from the iterator. It will throw a NoSuchElementException if there are no more elements in the iterator. In your case, you are trying to get the next element after you have already iterated over the two windows. The solution is to store the first and second window ids in separate variables before you try to get the next window id.

```java
Set<String> windowsid = driver.getWindowHandles();
Iterator<String> iterate = windowsid.iterator();

String mainwindow_id = iterate.next();
String tabbedwindow_id = iterate.next();
```

This way, you are only trying to get the next element when you actually need it.

This should resolve your error.
